titlestmt.titleproper: Sawyer Falk papers relating to the Federal Theater Project

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-04-06 17:12:14 -0400.

did.unittitle: Sawyer Falk papers relating to the Federal Theater Project

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The Archives of American art does not own the original papers. Use is limited to the microfilm copy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence with Falk regarding the Federal Theater Project in New York, particularly at the Civic University Theater in Syracuse. Correspondents include Hallie Flanagan, National Director of FTP. Also, programs, clippings, miscellaneous printed material, and a copy of INJUNCTION GRANTED, a play published in 1938.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: 35mm microfilm reel NDA 19 available for use at Archives of American Art offices and through interlibrary loan.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: Originals returned to the Library-Archives, Syracuse University, Syracuse, N.Y. after microfilming.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Educator; Syracuse, New York. Director of the Drama Department at the University of Syracuse. Active in the Federal Theater Project.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The lender, Syracuse University Library and Archives, has Falk's papers. Falk was a professor of drama at the University.
